title: Going to Denmark
content:
I'll be away for a few days, see you guys when I return on 18th (this month, and this year). [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Be nice! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rasta.gif[/img] This'll be my last post until I return. Now I have to pack! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

While we're at it, post here your current vacation plans, if going anywhere sometime. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: PARTY
content:
Party it up, KR! Scoootaaahh!

Holiday plans, eh?

In a bit over a week, I'll be heading to [url=http://www.syntaxparty.org/]Syntax Party[/url], a demo party that's taking place in Melbourne. I've been looking forward to it for a long while.

In the longerish-term, I'm heading up to the Gold Coast for ten days with some friends, at the beginning of September. Much theme park visitage shall transpire, and hopefully we'll be able to find some decent nightclubs (though such a thing is proving difficult to find).

title: Re: Going to Denmark
content:
Whoah - I'm in Melbourne till the 21st...reading the page it's not clear whether I can just pop on and have a look at what is brewing at that particular point without staying longer etc...but yeah, I'd be keen to check it out.------------------
[url=http://www.szevvy.net]www.szevvy.net[/url], for all your Wombat needs. You know you want to.
A member of the LevelLord fan club.

title: Re: hehe
content:
Woo! I'm leaving for Melbourne tomorree afternoon. Some friends and I have booked a hotel for three nights, and once I'm done demoing, we've gathered a decent crowd for some clubbing. Though it depends what the afterparty for Syntax is like as to whether I try my luck with the clubs.

Got my demo under way, too. I'm surprised how much I've accomplished so far in a 72 hour period. The engine is going to be used for an oldschool style platform game eventually, but I won't reveal anything further until it's released at pouet.

Also, welcome back, KR! Nice pogo sighting.

title: Re: Syntax
content:
Man, that was a great party! After five days of furious coding (with about nine hours total on the day), my demo was released. It didn't rank exceptionally high, but of course that's not the reason I made it. I'll keep y'all posted when a link exists to the party version. I'll be working on a final version in the upcoming daylight.

During the party, I ducked around the corner to where my cousin, Safari Boy [plug]iamed.com.au[/plug] lives. Conveniently enough. I returned to the Syntax party with his latest track, which he'd agreed to provide for the demo. Out the front was a lad with a ponytail, who introduced himself by his real name. Michael was it? Eh, I don't remember--I was in a hurry to get back to my demo. He told me to make sure to leave the magazine jammed in the doorway so the door didn't lock itself.

Anyway, back inside I was sitting there at my laptop coding away, as one of the other sceners made a lap around the room gathering aliases for the greets. Pulling up next to me, I heard Szevvy spelt out. I dropped everything, turned to my left and exclaimed, "YOU'RE Szevvy?" The same person I'd met out the front.

Craziness. So, I've officially met IRL someone from the PCKF!

Now I wanna see a Keen party.
